answers.answer: A resting HR of 40 is not normal, nor particularly threatening in my mind;  however, it could be the root cause for you SOB and light-headed, especially when arising or quickly changing your level of physical activity.  Do you know what your HR goes to when you start physical activities, such as  walking, going up stairs?  If you HR doesn't go up over 60 in those cases I think there is a problem.I don't know much about diabetes, so there may be a some interaction between that and the low HR, but some of your symptoms could be due just to the low HR.
